title: Industrial Canada
creator_credit: ONF | NFB and Guy L. Cote
brief_description: A documentary account of Canada’s industrial development. The film traces the country’s transformation from a strictly agricultural economy to an increasingly industrial one, commenting on the impetus given by World War II. The Canada of today presents a diversity of industrial activity, with rich natural resources of every description forming the basis of export and manufacture.
